thread.title: Perodua Kelisa splits in half after head-on collision in Seremban
thread.title_full: Perodua Kelisa splits in half after head-on collision in Seremban - Nation | The Star Online

author: thestar.com.my
title: Perodua Kelisa splits in half after head-on collision in Seremban
text:
SEREMBAN: Two friends travelling to work in Kuala Pilah were killed in a two-vehicle collision near the Bukit Putus stretch along Jalan Seremban-Kuala Pilah near here. 
Shahrulnizam Abu Hassan and Zahari Mashor, both 33, were travelling in a Perodua Kelisa and were   the 8am accident.
The impact of the crash caused their car to break in two.
Shahrulnizam was an employee of a bank while Zahari was a government servant.
Senawang Fire and Rescue Department operations chief Zainurin Sharif said four people in the other car, a Perodua Myvi, sustained serious injuries.
Two of the four were Nurul Syafina Abdul Mulop, 23 and Nursyahira Adila Saiful Zaman, 20.
The identities of the other two occupants of the car - a male and another female - had yet to be established.
Seremban OCPD ACP Thiew Hock Poh said preliminary investigations showed that the driver of the Kelisa lost control of the vehicle causing it to swerve into the opposite lane before crashing into the Myvi.
In a separate accident, a policeman was killed when his car collided with a van along Jalan Dato Sheikh Ahmad here.
Lance Corporal Clarence Pius, 25 was believed to have been heading home to Taman Satria in Senawang when the accident happened at 4.35am.
Pius, who was driving a Proton Wira, died on the spot.
Both cases were being investigated under section 41 of the Road Transport Act 1987.
